result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
Restitution of $7,779.23 has been paid in full.

No Contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint. Maintain absolute sobriety. Comply with random urine screens. No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. To report 01/05/2016 by 06:00pm

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

defendant.name: Schultz, Michael J

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael J Schultz in court with Attorney David I. Rothstein.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Natalie Schiferl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State files an amended information.  Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count #1 on amended information.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1 on amended information.  State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Rothstein makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____No contact with: victim listed in criminal complaint


RESTITUTION:  $7,779.23 - HAS BEEN PAID IN FULL

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  20 DAYS,  Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence 1/5/16 by 6:00 p.m.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael J Schultz in court with attorney David I. Rothstein.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended information previously filed is now withdrawn. Atty Boese requests a plea/sentencing date about 30 days out for restitution amount to be determined and paid. Plea questionnaire/waiver is also withdrawn. Case set for plea/sentencing hearing.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
Sentencing memorandum filed by Attorney Rothstein.
(Fax) Dated today, from Atty Rothstein to Judge Carter, giving information for 10/12/15 sentencing.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant Michael J Schultz in court.  Defendant not to enter any establishment whose primary business to to sell or serve alcohol.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Michael J Schultz in court with attorney David I. Rothstein.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 10:00 am.
